parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: It is advantageous to, it profits.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and keimai; to lie all around, i.e. Inclose, encircle, hamper.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The neck. Probably from trecho; the throat, i.e. life.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to fling (see in ekteino), which indicates an extended projection); by qualification, to deposit; by extension, to disperse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).
